text:
SECTION: 2013 Third Place (S3) Question 1 Assumption
CONTEXT: Volume of plastic in landfills (Density Integration).
CONTENT: The model assumes that the **density function $p(d)$** (density as a function of depth) derived from core samples is **representative of the entire landfill volume**. It assumes that the **composition of plastic waste** remains constant over the life of the landfill.

SECTION: 2013 Third Place (S3) Question 1 Model
CONTEXT: Volume of plastic in landfills.
CONTENT: A Density Integration model. Instead of assuming constant density, they derived a non-constant density function p(d) based on depth and integrated it to calculate the total volume of plastic waste.
